Dam.Description: Dams provide a reliable source of water to hydropower plants, which generate electricity from the flowing water.
Dams create reservoirs by blocking the flow of water, which can be used for various purposes such as irrigation, drinking water supply, and flood control.
Dams control the release of water from the reservoir, ensuring a steady flow in the downstream river, which can be beneficial for navigation, agriculture, and ecosystem stability.
Dams can alter the natural habitat of fish by obstructing their migration routes and changing the water temperature and flow, which can impact fish populations and biodiversity.
